alert.note: Alert for Northwest Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 29 at 1:49AM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: .Monsoonal moisture in place over the region will lead to numerous thunderstorms through Friday...especially during the afternoon and evening hours. Storms will produce heavy rainfall leading to flash flooding. This risk will be greatest for burn scars, but several roads could also experience flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by multiple rounds of thunderstorms producing excessive rainfall. Rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches an hour possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arizona, including the following area, Northwest Plateau. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff and heavy downpours may result in the rapid onset of flooding in area washes, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: You should monitor the forecast and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. If you come across a flooded roadway, turn around, don`t drown.
